pr_title: Enroll token validation for one time use and restrict usage to mapped participant

timeline.message: token validation for one time use and restrict usage against unmapped participant

timeline.bodyText:
[enroll-mgmt Checks] reported by reviewdog 🐶
Wrong lexicographical order for 'com.google.cloud.healthcare.fdamystudies.model.UserDetailsBO' import. Should be before 'org.springframework.stereotype.Service'.
timeline.author: github-actions

timeline.bodyText:
[enroll-mgmt Checks] reported by reviewdog 🐶
Line is longer than 100 characters (found 137).
timeline.author: github-actions
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -120,7 +125,7 @@ public boolean hasParticipant(@NotNull String studyId, @NotNull String tokenValu
               .createQuery(
                   "from ParticipantStudiesBO PS,StudyInfoBO SB, ParticipantRegistrySite PR"
                       + " where SB.id =PS.studyInfo.id and PS.participantRegistrySite.id=PR.id"
-                      + " and PS.status='Enrolled' and PR.enrollmentToken=:token and SB.customId=:studyId")
+                      + " and PS.status in ('Enrolled','Withdrawn','inProgress') and PR.enrollmentToken=:token and SB.customId=:studyId")

timeline.author: zohrehj

timeline.bodyText: change to studyID similar to above. please name params consistently.
timeline.author: zohrehj
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -21,7 +23,8 @@
 
   public boolean hasParticipant(@NotNull String shortName, @NotNull String tokenValue);

replies.bodyText: changed this to studyId to make it consistent
replies.author: aswinijena100

timeline.bodyText:
this query assumes that a token is unique within the context of a study_id.
I do not see that as a constraint in the database, please add it, otherwise your token validation would take other participants into account and fail to validate.
timeline.author: zohrehj
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -120,7 +125,7 @@ public boolean hasParticipant(@NotNull String studyId, @NotNull String tokenValu
               .createQuery(
                   "from ParticipantStudiesBO PS,StudyInfoBO SB, ParticipantRegistrySite PR"
                       + " where SB.id =PS.studyInfo.id and PS.participantRegistrySite.id=PR.id"
-                      + " and PS.status='Enrolled' and PR.enrollmentToken=:token and SB.customId=:studyId")
+                      + " and PS.status in ('Enrolled','Withdrawn','inProgress') and PR.enrollmentToken=:token and SB.customId=:studyId")

replies.bodyText: As we discussed database constraints will be taken care as part of data integrity issue fixes.
replies.author: aswinijena100

replies.bodyText: let's fix the ones you are working on when you have the context fresh in your mind. It will probably take less time.
replies.author: zohrehj

replies.bodyText: Added the fixes to this PR now along with test case modification to accommodate the data integrity checks
replies.author: aswinijena100

timeline.bodyText:
nit: isEnrollmentTokenValid
You are using the term studyToken frequently here, whereas the correct term should be enrollmentToken
timeline.author: zohrehj

timeline.bodyText:
I am confused with this code, why are you checking for participants associated with a token? and looking at their status?
Doesn't it make more sense to simply flag a token as used and/or remove it after the user has registered?
timeline.author: zohrehj

replies.bodyText: In the current scope the token cannot be removed as response server referred these tokens.  And the reason we added this check is to restrict the token usage against mapped to email id only .
replies.author: aswinijena100

timeline.message:

timeline.bodyText:
these are all the values for ParticpantStudyStateStatus, are we missing a value?
If not, maybe we don't need to filter by the status, if all status values are allowed
timeline.author: zohrehj

replies.bodyText: Yes, we have few more status like notEligible,yetToJoin,etc. But those are not required in the current scope, hence did not added. However I will add those values in enum and merge the code for future usage.
